00019 /*

00022 #include "mypopen.h"

00024 /*
00025  * ------------------------------------------------- local static variables --
00026  */
00027 static FILE* fp = NULL;

00029 
00030 /*
00031  * ------------------------------------------------------ mypopen -function --
00032  */
00033 // BSP: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9255425/writing-to-a-pipe-with-a-child-and-parent-process    
00034 FILE *mypopen(const char *command, const char *type)
00035 {
00036         int fd[2];
00037         pid_t childpid;
00038         
00039         if (fp != NULL)
00040         {
00041                 errno = EAGAIN;
00042                 return NULL;
00043         }
00044         
00045         if ((strcmp(type, "r") != 0 && strcmp(type, "w") != 0) || command == NULL)
00046         {
00047                 // no valid type
00048                 errno = EINVAL;
00049                 return NULL;
00050         }
00051         
00052         /* Open new pipe
00053      * - return value fd[0] is for reading
00054          * - return value fd[1] is for writing
00055      */
00056      if(pipe(fd))
00057         {
00058                 // pipe failed: according to documentation NULL should be returned
00059                 return NULL;
00060         }
00061         
00062         /*
00063      *if fork() is successful it return twice:
00064      * - in parent process the return value is the process id (PID) of the childprocess
00065      * - in child process the return value is 0
00066      */
00067     childpid = fork();
00068         
00070         if(childpid == (pid_t) 0)
00071         {
00072                 // read command
00073                 if (strcmp(type, "r"))
00074                         childAction(fd, READ_END, WRITE_END, command);
00075                 // write command                
00076                 else 
00077                         childAction(fd, WRITE_END, READ_END, command);
00078         }
00080         else if (childpid > (pid_t) 0)
00081         {
00082                 // read command
00083                 if (strcmp(type, "r"))
00084                         fp = parentAction(fd, WRITE_END, READ_END, type);
00085                 // write command                
00086                 else 
00087                         fp = parentAction(fd, READ_END, WRITE_END, type);
00088         }
00089         else 
00090         {
00091                 // fork failed: according to documentation NULL should be returned, but before close pipe:
00092                 close (fd[READ_END]);
00093                 close (fd[WRITE_END]);
00094                 return NULL;
00095         }
00096         
00097         return fp;
00098 }

00103 /*
00104  * ------------------------------------------------------ mypclose -function --
00105  */
00106 int mypclose(FILE *stream)
00107 {
00108         return pclose(stream);
00109 }

00117 /*
00118  * ------------------------------------------------------- help - functions --
00119  */
00120 static void childAction(int fd[2], int unused_end, int used_end, const char *command)
00121 {
00122         // close unused pipe end
00123         close (fd[unused_end]);
00124         
00125         // Link STDOUT with pipe fd
00126         if (dup2(fd[used_end], STDOUT_FILENO) == -1) {
00127                 // dup2 failed: close pipe and end child process (NO RETURN, because then child and parent would send return value to main) 
00128                 close (fd[used_end]);
00129                 _exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00130         }
00131         
00132         // Execute the command in a shell:
00133         execl("/bin/sh", "sh", "-c", command, NULL);
00134         
00135         // This code only get executed if execl fails. This code is used to "kill" the child process:
00136         _exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00137 }
00138 
00139 static FILE * parentAction(int fd[2], int unused_end, int used_end, const char *type)
00140 {
00141         FILE* fp_temp = NULL; 
00142         
00143         // close unused pipe end
00144         close (fd[unused_end]);
00145         
00146         // Link STDIN with pipe fd
00147         if (dup2(fd[used_end], STDIN_FILENO) == -1) {
00148                 // dup2 failed 
00149                 close (fd[used_end]);
00150                 return NULL;
00151         }
00152         
00153         // Convert file descriptor into file pointer
00154         if ((fp_temp = fdopen(fd[used_end], type)) == NULL) 
00155         {
00156                 // fdopen failed: close pipe and return null
00157                 close(fd[used_end]);
00158                 return NULL;
00159         }
00160         
00161         return fp_temp;
00162 }
